page.title: 01Torquay and the Torbay Area
page.content: The building of The Great Western Railway and its extension to South Devon heralded the era of long distance travel for large numbers of the population.From the time of the completion of the line to Torquay and its extension to Paignton,Churston and Kingswear in 1861,the popularity of the area as a holiday centre grew rapidly. In the space of a few years the bay was transformed.Torquay expanded from a small town with a few hotels and a small harbour into one of the most successful resorts in England boasting some of the finest hotels.The need for more modest accommodation created the almost continuous band of guest houses stretching to beyond Goodrington and the expansion of Brixham from a fishing village into a crowded town.
